document_title: Ginsenoside Reshapes Intestinal Microecology to Alleviate Microgravity Stress
summary_full: This study investigated the effects of Ginseng Total Saponins (GTSs) on intestinal homeostasis disruption caused by simulated microgravity using a hindlimb suspension (HLS) rat model. The research found that GTSs intervention effectively mitigated intestinal injury, evidenced by reduced pathological damage, increased tight junction protein expression, and decreased inflammatory factors. GTSs also restored intestinal immunity-related gene levels and remodeled the gut microbiota, notably increasing the abundance of short-chain fatty acid (SCFA) metabolism-related bacteria and consequently boosting propionic and butyric acid levels. The findings suggest that GTSs improve microecological disorders and impaired immune function induced by weightlessness, potentially through an "intestinal immune - microbiota - metabolic" pathway, providing a basis for developing GTSs-based space health products.
key_findings: GTSs intervention improved intestinal injury in simulated weightlessness rats, reducing pathological damage and increasing tight junction proteins.
GTSs treatment restored intestinal immunity-related gene expression and modulated T cell proportions (CD3+CD4+ and CD3+CD8+) in mesenteric lymph nodes.
GTSs remodeled the gut microbiota, increasing the abundance of SCFA metabolism-related bacteria.
GTSs treatment significantly increased the levels of propionic acid and butyric acid in the gut.
Transcriptomic analysis revealed that GTSs reversed the downregulation of innate immune-related genes (e.g., Isg15, Slfn4, Ly6e, Ifi27l2b) induced by simulated weightlessness.
future_research_fields: Detailed investigation of specific regulatory pathways of GTSs on intestinal immunity, gut microbiota, and microbial metabolites.
Exploration of the effects of natural ingredients like ginseng on astronaut health and homeostasis during spaceflight.
Development of precise GTSs formulations for space-health products.

conclusions: Ginseng total saponins (GTSs) effectively improve intestinal microecological disorders and impaired immune function caused by simulated weightlessness. The underlying mechanism involves the "intestinal immune - microbiota - metabolic" pathway, suggesting GTSs as a potential therapeutic agent for spaceflight-induced intestinal issues.
impact_statement: This study provides a theoretical basis for developing ginseng-derived products to maintain astronaut intestinal health during long-duration space missions.
